hypothesis_content.title: BTC Volatility Squeeze Breakout with Regime Confirmation
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC enters a Bollinger Band squeeze (20-day BB width < 30% of its 60-day average) during a NEUTRAL regime, a breakout above the upper band on above-average volume will lead to a directional move exceeding 1.5x the pre-squeeze average true range within 5 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes often precede volatility expansion. A Bollinger Band squeeze indicates compression that typically resolves directionally. Volume confirmation filters false breakouts. The 1.5x ATR target captures the initial expansion move.
entry_conditions: BTC 20-day Bollinger Band width < 0.3 * 60-day average BB width
BTC closes above upper Bollinger Band (20,2)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price reaches 1.5x ATR(14) from entry price
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes below middle Bollinger Band (20 SMA)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout fails to reach 1.5x ATR target within 5 days in >55% of occurrences, or more than 40% of breakouts immediately reverse below middle BB.
